ground_truth: The scene begins as we top the rise and the smoggy vastness of Los Angeles at twilight stretches out before us. It is late, and the supermarket is all but deserted. We are tracking in on a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy case. His rumpled look and relaxed manner suggest a man in whom casualness runs deep. He is feeling quarts of milk for coldness and examining their expiration dates. The Dude glances furtively about and then opens a quart of milk. He sticks his nose in the spout and sniffs while a woman waits with arms folded. The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side and is making out a check to Ralph's for sixty-nine cents. A small black-and-white TV next to her register shows George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors spinning behind him. The Dude is going up the walkway of a small Venice bungalow court. He holds the paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other. He awkwardly hugs the grocery bag against his chest as he turns a key in his door. The Dude enters and flicks on a light. His head is grabbed from behind and tucked into an armpit. We track with him as he is rushed through the living room, his arm holding the satchel flailing away from his body. Going into the bedroom, the outflung satchel catches a piece of doorframe and wallboard and rips through it, leaving a hole. The paper bag hugged to his chest explodes milk as it hits the toilet rim, and the satchel pulverizes tile as it crashes to the floor. His head is plunged into the toilet. Hands haul the Dude out of the toilet. The Dude blubbers and gasps for air. His head is plunged back into the toilet. The hands haul him out again, dripping and gasping. His head is plunged back in. The inquisitor hauls the Dude's head out one last time and flops him over so that he sits on the floor, back against the toilet. Looming over him is a strapping blond man. Beyond, in the living room, a young Chinese man unzips his fly and walks over to a rug. He starts peeing on the rug. The Dude gropes back in the toilet with one hand. The Dude's hand comes out of the toilet bowl with his sunglasses. The blond man stops to unzip the satchel. He pulls out a bowling ball and examines it in the manner of a superstitious native. The Dude puts on his dripping sunglasses. The blond man drops the ball, which pulverizes more tile. The two men look at each other. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose with one finger and peeks over them.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The panorama commences as we crest the ascent and the smoggy expanse of Los Angeles at dusk extends out before us. It is late, and the grocery store is all but abandoned. We are following in on a fortyish fellow in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy section. His wrinkled appearance and easygoing manner imply a man in whom nonchalance runs deep. He is feeling quarts of milk for chilliness and inspecting their expiration dates. The Dude glances stealthily around and then opens a quart of milk. He sticks his nose in the spout and sniffs while a woman waits with arms crossed. The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side and is filling out a check to Ralph's for sixty-nine cents. A small black-and-white television next to her register displays George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors whirling behind him. The Dude is moving up the footpath of a small Venice cottage court. He carries the paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other. He clumsily hugs the grocery bag against his torso as he turns a key in his entrance. The Dude enters and flicks on a light. His head is grabbed from behind and tucked into an armpit. We follow with him as he is rushed through the living room, his arm holding the satchel flailing away from his body. Entering the bedroom, the outflung satchel catches a piece of doorframe and drywall and rips through it, leaving a hole. The paper sack hugged to his torso bursts milk as it strikes the toilet rim, and the satchel shatters tile as it crashes to the floor. His head is thrust into the toilet. Hands pull the Dude out of the toilet. The Dude blubbers and gasps for air. His head is thrust back into the toilet. The hands pull him out again, dripping and gasping. His head is thrust back in. The questioner hauls the Dude's head out one final time and flops him over so that he sits on the floor, back against the toilet. Towering over him is a strapping blond man. Beyond, in the living room, a young Chinese man unzips his fly and steps over to a rug. He begins urinating on the rug. The Dude gropes back in the toilet with one hand. The Dude's hand emerges from the toilet bowl with his sunglasses. The blond man pauses to unzip the satchel. He extracts a bowling ball and inspects it in the manner of a superstitious native. The Dude dons his dripping sunglasses. The blond man drops the ball, which shatters more tile. The two men gaze at each other. The Dude draws his sunglasses down his nose with one finger and peeks over them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The scene starts as we reach the top of a rise and see the smoggy vastness of Los Angeles at twilight. It's late, and the supermarket is nearly empty. We focus on a man in his forties, wearing Bermuda shorts and sunglasses, at the dairy case. His rumpled look suggests deep-rooted casualness. He checks milk quarts for coldness and expiration dates. The Dude furtively opens a quart, sniffs it, and makes a check to Ralph's for sixty-nine cents as a woman waits. A small TV by her register shows George Bush on the White House lawn with spinning helicopter rotors. The Dude walks up a small Venice bungalow court with a paper sack and a leatherette satchel. He awkwardly hugs the bag while unlocking his door. Inside, a hand grabs his head, and we follow him being rushed through the living room, his flailing arm catching the doorframe, ripping wallboard. The satchel crashes to the floor, pulverizing tile, as milk spills over the toilet rim. The Dude's head is repeatedly plunged into the toilet, leaving him gasping. A strapping blond man looms over him, while in the living room, a young Chinese man pees on a rug. The Dude retrieves his sunglasses from the toilet. The blond man examines a bowling ball from the satchel and drops it, smashing more tile. The two men exchange looks as the Dude peeks over his dripping sunglasses.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: As twilight falls over smoggy Los Angeles, a nearly empty supermarket hosts a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts, examining milk cartons. This casual man, The Dude, uses his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to write a 69-cent check. A TV shows George Bush on the White House lawn. At his Venice bungalow, The Dude awkwardly juggles a grocery bag and satchel, exploding milk and smashing tiles as intruders attack, dunking his head in a toilet. A blond interrogator looms over him while a young Chinese man urinates on a rug. The Dude retrieves his sunglasses from the toilet as the blond examines a bowling ball from the satchel, then drops it, shattering more tiles. They exchange glances, and The Dude adjusts his sunglasses.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The scene unfolds dramatically as we crest the rise, revealing the smoggy, expansive landscape of Los Angeles bathed in the soft glow of twilight, stretching far and wide before us. It is late in the evening, and the nearby supermarket appears to be almost entirely deserted, with just a few stragglers wandering its aisles. Our focus narrows in on a man, perhaps in his forties, who is in a relaxed state, wearing Bermuda shorts and sunglasses as he peruses the dairy case. His disheveled appearance and easygoing demeanor indicate a person for whom casualness is a way of life. He is meticulously feeling the quarts of milk for their coldness, scrutinizing their expiration dates with care. The Dude, as he is known, takes a cautious glance around the empty aisle and then proceeds to open a quart of milk. He places his nose at the spout and takes a sniff, all while a woman stands nearby, arms crossed, waiting patiently. 

The Dude positions his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side as he writes out a check to Ralph's for the modest amount of sixty-nine cents. Nearby, a small black-and-white television screen at the checkout counter displays an image of George Bush standing on the White House lawn, framed by the spinning rotors of a helicopter. With a paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other, the Dude makes his way up the walkway of a modest bungalow court in Venice. He clumsily hugs the grocery bag to his chest while turning the key in the lock of his door. Upon entering, he promptly flicks on the light switch. 

Without warning, his head is gripped from behind and yanked into the confines of an armpit. As we follow him, he is hurried through the living room, his arm, which is clutching the satchel, flailing wildly away from his body. In the chaotic rush into the bedroom, the outstretched satchel catches the edge of the doorframe and wallboard, tearing a hole through it. Hugging the bag tightly to his chest, the contents explode as the bag hits the rim of the toilet, sending milk everywhere, while the satchel smashes into the floor, damaging the tile. His head is forcibly plunged into the toilet water. Rough hands yank the Dude out of the toilet, leaving him sputtering and gasping desperately for air. His tormentors thrust his head back into the water, pull him out again, and let him catch his breath briefly before dunking him in once more. Finally, the interrogator drags the Dude's head out a final time, flopping him over so that he is sitting on the floor, his back resting against the toilet bowl. Looming over him is a tall, blond man with a strong build. 

Meanwhile, in the living room, a young Chinese man is unzipping his fly and making his way over to a rug, where he begins defiling it. The Dude's hand fumbles back into the toilet, emerging with his sunglasses dripping wet. The blond man pauses his actions to unzip the satchel, pulling out a bowling ball and inspecting it with the air of someone handling a mysterious, superstitious object. The Dude, unperturbed, puts on his wet sunglasses. The blond man lets the ball drop, shattering more of the tile beneath. The two men exchange looks, and the Dude lowers his sunglasses with one finger and peers over the top at him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The dramatic scene starts to unfold as we reach the crest of a rise, unveiling the vast and smog-laden panorama of Los Angeles. This extensive landscape is wrapped in the gentle twilight glow, spreading out far and wide in front of us. It's late in the evening, and the nearby supermarket appears to be almost devoid of activity, with only a few lingering individuals roaming its aisles. Our attention shifts and narrows in on a man, who appears to be in his forties. He seems to be in a relaxed, laid-back state, casually dressed in Bermuda shorts and sporting sunglasses as he examines the dairy section. His somewhat disheveled appearance and easygoing manner suggest a person for whom casualness is a fundamental lifestyle choice. He is meticulously feeling the quarts of milk, checking for their cold temperature, and carefully scrutinizing their expiration dates. The Dude, as he is known, takes a cautious look around the empty aisle and then decides to open a quart of milk. He places his nose at the spout, taking a sniff, all while remaining oblivious to a woman nearby. She stands patiently, her arms crossed, simply observing the scene.

The Dude places his Ralph's Shopper's Club card aside as he proceeds to write out a check to Ralph's for the modest sum of sixty-nine cents. Nearby, at the checkout counter, a small black-and-white television screen displays an image of George Bush standing on the White House lawn, all framed by the whirring rotors of a helicopter in the background. With a paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other, the Dude makes his way up the pathway of a modest bungalow court located in Venice. He awkwardly embraces the grocery bag against his chest while he turns the key in the lock of his door. Upon entering, he swiftly flicks on the light switch.

Without any warning, his head is suddenly seized from behind and forcefully pulled into the confines of an armpit. As we trail behind him, he is hurriedly dragged through the living room, his arm, clutching the satchel, flails wildly away from his body. In the chaotic rush into the bedroom, the outstretched satchel catches on the edge of the doorframe and wallboard, tearing a hole through it. Hugging the bag tightly to his chest, the contents explode when the bag collides with the rim of the toilet, causing milk to splatter everywhere, while the satchel crashes to the floor, damaging the tile. His head is violently plunged into the toilet water. Rough hands yank the Dude out of the toilet, leaving him sputtering and gasping desperately for air. His aggressors submerge his head back into the water, lift him out again, allow him to catch a breath briefly, and then dunk him in once more. At last, the interrogator drags the Dude's head out a final time, positioning him so that he is sitting on the floor, with his back resting against the toilet bowl. Looming over him stands a tall, blond man with a strong, muscular build.

Meanwhile, in the living room, a young Chinese man is in the process of unzipping his fly and moving over to a rug, where he begins defiling it. The Dude's hand fumbles back into the toilet, emerging with his sunglasses dripping wet. The blond man pauses his actions to unzip the satchel, retrieving a bowling ball and inspecting it as if handling a mysterious and superstitious object. The Dude, unfazed and composed, puts on his wet sunglasses. The blond man lets the ball drop, shattering more of the tile beneath them. The two men exchange glances, and the Dude lowers his sunglasses with one finger, peering over the top at him.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As we ascend to the crest of the hill, the sprawling, smog-laden expanse of Los Angeles unfolds before us, bathed in the dim light of twilight. In the late hours, the supermarket is nearly empty, creating an almost eerie silence. We focus in on a middle-aged man, sporting Bermuda shorts and sunglasses, as he stands at the dairy case, his appearance rumpled and his demeanor exuding an innate laid-back attitude. He methodically feels the quarts of milk to determine their coldness and scrutinizes their expiration dates with intent. The Dude, maintaining a cautious awareness of his surroundings, furtively scans the area before discreetly opening a quart of milk. He brings it to his face, inserting his nose into the spout to take a sniff, all while a woman nearby patiently waits, arms crossed. Beside him, his Ralph's Shopper's Club card rests to one side as he carefully writes out a check to Ralph's for sixty-nine cents. A small black-and-white TV positioned by the register displays an image of George Bush standing on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors whirring behind him. Transitioning to a different scene, the Dude walks along the pathway leading to a small bungalow court in Venice, clutching a paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other. As he reaches his door, he juggles the grocery bag against his chest to free a hand, using it to turn the key in the lock. Upon entering, he quickly flicks on a light switch, only to be abruptly seized from behind, his head ensnared in an armpit. We follow his disoriented movements as he is forcibly rushed through the living room, his arm, which holds the satchel, swinging wildly away from his body. As they move into the bedroom, the flailing satchel catches the edge of the doorframe and wallboard, tearing through them and leaving behind a gaping hole. As he is propelled forward, the grocery bag, held tightly to his chest, collides with the toilet rim, bursting and spilling milk everywhere, while the satchel crashes to the floor, shattering tiles upon impact. His captor then plunges the Dude's head into the toilet bowl. The hands grip him firmly, pulling him out momentarily, allowing him to utter incoherent, blubbering gasps for air. His head is thrust back under the water. Once more the hands retrieve him, his breath now ragged and desperate before plunging him in again. Finally, the aggressor lifts his drenched form out a final time, repositioning him so he sits slumped against the base of the toilet, his breathing labored and his body soaking. Towering over him is a strong blond man, his presence intimidating. Meanwhile, in the living room, a young Chinese man methodically unzips his fly and strides over to a rug, proceeding to urinate on it. In a moment of desperation, the Dude reaches back into the toilet with his hand, feeling around in the murky water until his hand emerges holding his sunglasses. As the blond man pauses to unzip the satchel, he extracts a bowling ball, inspecting it with the reverence and curiosity of a superstitious native. The Dude, still dripping, places his retrieved sunglasses back on his face. Without warning, the blond man releases the bowling ball, and it crashes to the floor, further demolishing the already damaged tiles. The two men lock eyes, a silent exchange passing between them. The Dude, in an almost defiant gesture, lowers his sunglasses down his nose with a single finger, peering over the top at his adversary.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As we reach the top of the rise, Los Angeles's smoggy vastness unfolds at twilight. It's late, and the nearly deserted supermarket houses a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy case. His disheveled appearance and laid-back demeanor suggest profound casualness. He checks milk quarts for coldness and expiration dates, sniffs one after a furtive glance, and starts making out a check for sixty-nine cents while a woman waits with crossed arms, a small TV showing George Bush behind her. The Dude then approaches a small Venice bungalow court, holding a grocery bag and satchel. Entering with some difficulty, he flicks on a light but is immediately grabbed and rushed through his home. His satchel catches and tears through a doorframe, as the milk explodes on the toilet rim, and the satchel crashes to the floor, breaking tile. His head is repeatedly plunged into the toilet, leaving him gasping. A strapping blond man towers over him while a young Chinese man urinates on a rug in the living room. Recovering his sunglasses from the toilet, the Dude watches as the blond man unzips the satchel, examines a bowling ball, and then drops it, breaking more tile. They exchange looks, and the Dude adjusts his dripping sunglasses.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we top the rise and the smoggy vastness of Los Angeles at twilight stretches out before us, a city known for its sprawling urban landscape and infamous traffic congestion. It is late, and the supermarket, one of the many branches of the popular Southern California chain Ralph's, is all but deserted. We are tracking in on a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy case. His rumpled look and relaxed manner suggest a man in whom casualness runs deep, reminiscent of the laid-back stereotype often attributed to California residents. He is feeling quarts of milk for coldness and examining their expiration dates. The Dude, a nickname for a character embodying a carefree and somewhat indifferent lifestyle, glances furtively about and then opens a quart of milk. He sticks his nose in the spout and sniffs while a woman waits with arms folded. The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side, a membership that allows customers to avail of discounts, and is making out a check to Ralph's for sixty-nine cents, an amount that underscores the seemingly insignificant nature of this purchase. A small black-and-white TV next to her register shows George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors spinning behind him, indicating a presidential departure or arrival, a scene typical for that era. The Dude is going up the walkway of a small Venice bungalow court, a nod to the eclectic and artsy neighborhood of Venice, known for its canals and beach. He holds the paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other. He awkwardly hugs the grocery bag against his chest as he turns a key in his door. The Dude enters and flicks on a light. His head is grabbed from behind and tucked into an armpit. We track with him as he is rushed through the living room, his arm holding the satchel flailing away from his body. Going into the bedroom, the outflung satchel catches a piece of doorframe and wallboard, which, built during the mid-20th century, isn't as durable as modern materials, and rips through it, leaving a hole. The paper bag hugged to his chest explodes milk as it hits the toilet rim, and the satchel pulverizes tile as it crashes to the floor. His head is plunged into the toilet. Hands haul the Dude out of the toilet. The Dude blubbers and gasps for air, a moment echoing the comedic yet absurd nature often found in dark humor scenes. His head is plunged back into the toilet. The hands haul him out again, dripping and gasping. His head is plunged back in. The inquisitor hauls the Dude's head out one last time and flops him over so that he sits on the floor, back against the toilet. Looming over him is a strapping blond man, whose intimidating presence suggests he is not someone to be trifled with. Beyond, in the living room, a young Chinese man unzips his fly and walks over to a rug, an item symbolically significant in some narratives for its supposed impact on the character’s life. He starts peeing on the rug. The Dude gropes back in the toilet with one hand. The Dude's hand comes out of the toilet bowl with his sunglasses, a peculiar but fitting accessory for the character. The blond man stops to unzip the satchel. He pulls out a bowling ball and examines it in the manner of a superstitious native, reminiscent of the mystique surrounding certain rituals or beliefs. The Dude puts on his dripping sunglasses. The blond man drops the ball, which pulverizes more tile. The two men look at each other. The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose with one finger and peeks over them, a classic gesture suggesting irony or disbelief.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we top the rise and the smoggy vastness of Los Angeles at twilight stretches out before us. It is late and the supermarket is all but deserted. We are tracking in on a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy case. His rumpled look and relaxed manner suggest a man in whom casualness runs deep. He is feeling quarts of milk for coldness and examining their expiration dates. The Dude glances furtively about and then opens a quart of milk. He sticks his nose in the spout and sniffs while a woman waits with arms folded. The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side and is making out a check to Ralph's for sixtynine cents. A small blackandwhite TV next to her register shows George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors spinning behind him. The Dude is going up the walkway of a small Venice bungalow court. He holds the paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other. He awkwardly hugs the grocery bag against his chest as he turns a key in his door. The Dude enters and flicks on a light. His head is grabbed from behind and tucked into an armpit. We track with him as he is rushed through the living room his arm holding the satchel flailing away from his body. Going into the bedroom the outflung satchel catches a piece of doorframe and wallboard and rips through it leaving a hole. The paper bag hugged to his chest explodes milk as it hits the toilet rim and the satchel pulverizes tile as it crashes to the floor. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we top the rise and the smoggy vastness of Los Angeles at twilight stretches out before us. It is late and the supermarket is all but deserted. We are tracking in on a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy case. His rumpled look and relaxed manner suggest a man in whom casualness runs deep. He is feeling quarts of milk for coldness and examining their expiration dates. The Dude glances furtively about and then opens a quart of milk. He sticks his nose in the spout and sniffs while a woman waits with arms folded. The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side and is making out a check to Ralph's for sixtynine cents. A small blackandwhite TV next to her register shows George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors spinning behind him. The Dude is going up the walkway of a small Venice bungalow court. He holds the paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other. He awkwardly hugs the grocery bag against his chest as he turns a key in his door. The Dude enters and flicks on a light. His head is grabbed from behind and tucked into an armpit. We track with him as he is rushed through the living room his arm holding the satchel flailing away from his body. Going into the bedroom the outflung satchel catches a piece of doorframe and wallboard and rips through it leaving a hole. The paper bag hugged to his chest explodes milk as it hits the toilet rim and the satchel pulverizes tile as it crashes to the floor. test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we top the rise and the foggy vastness of San Francisco at dawn stretches out before us. It is late, and the hardware store is all but deserted. We are tracking in on a fortyish man in cargo pants and a baseball cap at the plant nursery. His rumpled look and relaxed manner suggest a man in whom casualness runs deep. He is feeling potted ferns for moisture and examining their identification tags. The Dude glances furtively about and then opens a bag of soil. He sticks his nose in the opening and sniffs while a woman waits with arms folded. The Dude has his Home Depot Loyalty card to one side and is making out a check to Home Depot for sixty-nine cents. A small black-and-white TV next to her register shows George Bush on the Capitol steps with fountain water spraying behind him. The Dude is going up the walkway of a small Santa Monica apartment complex. He holds the canvas bag in one hand and a small velvet pouch in the other. He awkwardly hugs the tote bag against his chest as he turns a key in his door. The Dude enters and flicks on a light. His head is grabbed from behind and tucked into an armpit. We track with him as he is rushed through the living room, his arm holding the pouch flailing away from his body. Going into the bedroom, the outflung pouch catches a piece of curtain and window frame and rips through it, leaving a hole. The canvas bag hugged to his chest explodes potting soil as it hits the bathtub rim, and the pouch pulverizes tile as it crashes to the floor. His head is plunged into the bathtub. Hands haul the Dude out of the bathtub. The Dude blubbers and gasps for air. His head is plunged back into the bathtub. The hands haul him out again, dripping and gasping. His head is plunged back in. The inquisitor hauls the Dude's head out one last time and flops him over so that he sits on the floor, back against the bathtub. Looming over him is a strapping blond man. Beyond, in the living room, a young Chinese man unzips his windbreaker and walks over to a sofa. He starts pouring soda on the sofa. The Dude gropes back in the bathtub with one hand. The Dude's hand comes out of the bathtub with his baseball cap. The blond man stops to unzip the pouch. He pulls out a soccer ball and examines it in the manner of a superstitious native. The Dude puts on his wet baseball cap. The blond man drops the ball, which pulverizes more tile. The two men look at each other. The Dude pulls his cap down his nose with one finger and peeks over it.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we descend the hill and the foggy expanse of Los Angeles at twilight compresses ahead of us. It is late, and the supermarket is virtually bustling. We are gliding past a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses by the dairy case. His crumpled look and composed demeanor suggest a man in whom elegance lies dormant. He is juggling quarts of milk for weight and ignoring their expiration dates. The Dude peers inquisitively around and then drops a quart of milk. He dips his finger in the spout and tastes while a woman waits with arms akimbo. The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side and is doodling on a check to Ralph's for sixty-nine cents. A small black-and-white TV next to her register displays George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors whirring nearby. The Dude is skipping along the walkway of a small Venice bungalow court. He waves the paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other. He clumsily twirls the grocery bag under his arm as he spins a key in his door. The Dude exits and switches off a light. His head is patted from behind and tucked into an embrace. We float with him as he is guided through the living room, his arm gripping the satchel rhythmically. Entering the bedroom, the swinging satchel glances off a piece of doorframe and wallboard and scrapes it, leaving a mark. The paper bag cradled to his chest deflates as it touches the toilet rim, and the satchel fractures tile as it lands on the floor. His head is dipped into the toilet. Hands lift the Dude from the toilet. The Dude chuckles and breathes deeply. His head is dipped back into the toilet. The hands lift him out again, laughing and breathing. His head is dipped back in. The interrogator lifts the Dude's head out one last time and places him down so that he sits on the floor, back against the toilet. Hovering over him is a strapping blond man. Beyond, in the living room, a young Chinese man buttons his fly and walks over to a rug. He starts dancing on the rug. The Dude reaches back into the toilet with one hand. The Dude's hand emerges from the toilet bowl with his sunglasses. The blond man pauses to unzip the satchel. He pulls out a bowling ball and observes it in the manner of a suspicious tourist. The Dude puts on his dripping sunglasses. The blond man lifts the ball, which fractures more tile. The two men nod to each other. The Dude slides his sunglasses down his nose with one finger and peeks over them.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we crest the peak and the foggy expanse of Chicago at dusk stretches out before us. It is late, and the library is all but deserted. We are tracking in on a thirtyish woman in cargo pants and a sunhat at the produce section. Her wrinkled demeanor and carefree manner suggest a person in whom nonchalance runs deep. She is feeling oranges for firmness and examining their price tags. The Fish glances nervously around and then opens an orange. She sticks her nose in the peel and sniffs while a giraffe waits with hooves crossed. The Fish has her Charlie’s Discount Card to one side and is writing out a receipt to Charlie’s for ninety-six cents. A small black-and-white radio next to its shelf shows Oprah Winfrey on the Capitol lawn with wind chimes tinkling behind her. The Fish is going up the walkway of a small Miami apartment complex. She holds the backpack in one hand and a small velvet case in the other. She awkwardly hugs the backpack against her torso as she turns a combination in her gate. The Fish enters and flicks on a fan. Her foot is grabbed from behind and tucked into an elbow. We track with her as she is rushed through the kitchen, her limb holding the case flailing away from her body. Going into the closet, the outflung case catches a piece of bookshelf and wallpaper and rips through it, leaving a gap. The backpack hugged to her torso bursts oranges as it hits the bathtub rim, and the case pulverizes brick as it crashes to the ground. Her foot is plunged into the bathtub. Hooves haul the Fish out of the bathtub. The Fish blubbers and gasps for breath. Her foot is plunged back into the bathtub. The hooves haul her out again, dripping and gasping. Her foot is plunged back in. The investigator hauls the Fish's foot out one last time and flops her over so that she sits on the carpet, back against the bathtub. Looming over her is a towering red-haired woman. Beyond, in the kitchen, a young Japanese donkey unzips its saddle and trots over to a curtain. It starts nipping at the curtain. The Fish gropes back in the bathtub with one hand. The Fish's hand comes out of the bathtub with her sunhat. The red-haired woman stops to unzip the case. She pulls out a soccer ball and examines it in the manner of a curious alien. The Fish puts on her dripping sunhat. The red-haired woman drops the ball, which pulverizes more brick. The two figures look at each other. The Fish pulls her sunhat down her forehead with one finger and peeks over it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we cross the summit and the foggy expanse of San Francisco at dawn stretches out before us. It is early, and the library is all but empty. We are zooming in on a teenage girl in a floral dress and a baseball cap at the fruit stand. Her tidy look and energetic manner suggest a person in whom enthusiasm runs deep. She is picking apples for ripeness and observing their color. The Tourist peers cautiously around and then bites into a tomato. She dips her finger into the juice and tastes while a man stands with arms crossed. The Tourist has her Discount Shopper's card to one side and is writing a note to the store for ninety-two cents. A small black-and-white radio next to his register plays Frank Sinatra on the Hollywood Boulevard with traffic noises humming behind him. The Tourist is skipping up the pathway of a large Malibu apartment complex. She grasps the fruit basket in one hand and a small canvas bag in the other. She clumsily cradles the basket against her hip as she turns a handle on her gate. The Tourist exits and waves a flashlight. Her foot is grabbed from behind and stuffed into a boot. We glide with her as she is escorted through the dining room, her hand clutching the bag wobbling toward her head. Entering the kitchen, the swaying bag strikes a piece of molding and drywall and splits through it, creating a gap. The basket clutched to her hip spills juice as it grazes the table edge, and the bag shatters glassware as it lands on the countertop. Her foot is dipped into the sink. Arms tug the Tourist out of the sink. The Tourist sputters and coughs for breath. Her foot is dipped back into the sink. The arms draw her out again, soaking and wheezing. Her foot is dipped back in. The investigator lifts the Tourist’s foot out one final time and tilts her over so that she lies on the carpet, legs against the sink. Leaning over her is a lanky brunette woman. Nearby, in the dining room, a young Italian girl adjusts her shoes and shuffles over to a rug. She starts drawing on the rug. The Tourist reaches into the sink with one finger. The Tourist's finger emerges from the sink with her cap. The brunette woman pauses to adjust the bag. She pulls out a globe and studies it in the manner of a curious child. The Tourist dons her dripping cap. The brunette woman drops the globe, which shatters more glassware. The two women glance at each other. The Tourist nudges her cap up her forehead with one finger and peers above it.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The scene begins as we crest the wave and the foggy expanse of San Francisco at dusk spreads out before us. It is late, and the museum is all but deserted. We are focusing in on a fortyish man in cargo pants and a baseball cap at the cereal aisle. His disheveled look and laid-back demeanor suggest a man in whom nonchalance runs deep. He is tapping loaves of bread for freshness and inspecting their ingredient lists. The Dude glances covertly around and then tears open a loaf of bread. He sticks his nose in the bag and sniffs while a child waits with hands on hips. The Dude has his Library Membership card to one side and is filling out a form for a dollar ninety-nine. A small black-and-white radio next to her counter plays a speech by George Bush from the Oval Office with static crackling behind him. The Dude is strolling up the pathway of a small Santa Monica cottage court. He grips the cardboard box in one hand and a small woven basket in the other. He awkwardly hugs the box against his side as he twists a knob on his gate. The Dude steps inside and flips on a fan. His head is seized from behind and tucked into an elbow. The box hugged against his side erupts flour as it hits the bathtub edge, and the basket shatters glass as it crashes to the floor. His head is dunked into the bathtub. Hands yank the Dude out of the water. The Dude splutters and gulps for air. His head is dunked back into the water. The hands yank him out again, dripping and wheezing. His head is dunked back in. The interrogator yanks the Dude's head out one last time and flips him over so that he sits on the tiles, back against the faucet. Towering over him is a burly ginger man. Beyond, in the dining room, a young Japanese man adjusts his belt and walks over to a sofa. He starts spitting on the sofa. The Dude fumbles back in the bathtub with one hand. The Dude's hand emerges from the water with his baseball cap. The ginger man pauses to unclip the basket. He pulls out a soccer ball and inspects it in the manner of a curious archaeologist. The Dude puts on his dripping cap. The ginger man drops the ball, which shatters more glass. The two men gaze at each other. The Dude adjusts his cap down his forehead with one finger and peers over it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The episode unfolds as we crest the ridge and the foggy expanse of Chicago at dawn expands before us. It is early, and the library is mostly vacant. We are zooming in on a youthful woman in a trench coat and a fedora at the snack aisle. Her polished appearance and brisk demeanor suggest a person in whom formality runs strong. She is assessing cans of soup for freshness and inspecting their ingredient lists. The Lady peers anxiously around and then cracks open a can of soup. She dips her finger in the broth and tastes while a man waits with arms akimbo. The Lady has her Grocery Club ID to one side and is scribbling a receipt to Grocery for eighty-nine cents. A small color TV beside his counter displays Ronald Reagan on the Capitol steps with cars honking behind him. The Lady is heading down the corridor of a tiny Miami apartment complex. She grips the plastic bag in one hand and a tiny fabric clutch in the other. She awkwardly balances the shopping bag against her hip as she turns a lock in her gate. The Lady steps in and switches on a fan. Her arm is grabbed from the side and tucked into a shoulder. We glide with her as she is hurried through the kitchen, her hand clutching the clutch swinging away from her torso. Entering the den, the swinging clutch catches a bit of railing and brickwork and slices through it, leaving a gap. The plastic bag balanced on her hip bursts fruit juice as it strikes the sink edge, and the clutch shatters porcelain as it smashes to the ground. Her arm is plunged into the sink. Arms lift the Lady out of the sink. The Lady whimpers and struggles for breath. Her arm is plunged back into the sink. The arms drag her out again, sputtering and wheezing. Her arm is plunged once more. The interrogator hauls the Lady's arm out one final time and flips her over so that she rests on the couch, back against the sink. Towering above her is a lanky brunette woman. Nearby, in the kitchen, a young Russian girl unravels her belt and paces over to a sofa. She begins spilling water on the sofa. The Lady fumbles back in the sink with one arm. The Lady's arm emerges from the sink basin with her fedora. The brunette woman pauses to unfasten the clutch. She takes out a baseball and inspects it in the style of a cautious explorer. The Lady places on her dripping fedora. The brunette woman lets go of the ball, which shatters more porcelain. The two women gaze at one another. The Lady slides her fedora down her face with one hand and peers over it.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The scene opens with a smoggy view of Los Angeles at twilight. The supermarket is mostly empty as we follow a fortyish man, known as the Dude, who is laid-back and casual in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses while inspecting milk at the dairy aisle. He uses a Ralph's Shopper's Club card to write a check for sixty-nine cents and carries a paper sack and leather satchel back to his Venice bungalow. As the Dude enters his home, he is suddenly grabbed from behind and dragged through the living room, causing destruction along the way. His head is shoved into the toilet by a strapping blond man. Meanwhile, a young Chinese man urinates on the living room rug. The Dude retrieves his sunglasses from the toilet, and the blond man examines a bowling ball from the Dude's satchel before dropping it, breaking more tile. The Dude, wearing his wet sunglasses, exchanges a look with the blond man.

leatherette satchel in the other The Dude is going up the walkway of a small Venice bungalow court A small blackandwhite TV next to her register shows George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors spinning behind him The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side and is making out a check to Ralph's for sixtynine cents He sticks his nose in the spout and sniffs while a woman waits with arms folded The Dude glances furtively about and then opens a quart of milk He is feeling quarts of milk for coldness and examining their expiration dates His rumpled look and relaxed manner suggest a man in whom casualness runs deep We are tracking in on a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy case It is late and the supermarket is all but deserted The scene begins as we top the rise and the smoggy vastness of Los Angeles at twilight stretches out before us

test_cases.description: The Dude is going up the walkway of a small Venice bungalow court The Dude enters and flicks on a light The Dude glances furtively about and then opens a quart of milk His head is plunged back into the toilet The Dude puts on his dripping sunglasses His head is plunged back in The blond man stops to unzip the satchel The paper bag hugged to his chest explodes milk as it hits the toilet rim and the satchel pulverizes tile as it crashes to the floor He starts peeing on the rug Looming over him is a strapping blond man We track with him as he is rushed through the living room his arm holding the satchel flailing away from his body He holds the paper sack in one hand and a small leatherette satchel in the other He awkwardly hugs the grocery bag against his chest as he turns a key in his door The Dude gropes back in the toilet with one hand A small blackandwhite TV next to her register shows George Bush on the White House lawn with helicopter rotors spinning behind him The Dude blubbers and gasps for air He pulls out a bowling ball and examines it in the manner of a superstitious native He sticks his nose in the spout and sniffs while a woman waits with arms folded Beyond in the living room a young Chinese man unzips his fly and walks over to a rug The scene begins as we top the rise and the smoggy vastness of Los Angeles at twilight stretches out before us The two men look at each other His head is grabbed from behind and tucked into an armpit Hands haul the Dude out of the toilet We are tracking in on a fortyish man in Bermuda shorts and sunglasses at the dairy case The blond man drops the ball which pulverizes more tile The Dude's hand comes out of the toilet bowl with his sunglasses The hands haul him out again dripping and gasping His rumpled look and relaxed manner suggest a man in whom casualness runs deep The inquisitor hauls the Dude's head out one last time and flops him over so that he sits on the floor back against the toilet He is feeling quarts of milk for coldness and examining their expiration dates The Dude pulls his sunglasses down his nose with one finger and peeks over them Going into the bedroom the outflung satchel catches a piece of doorframe and wallboard and rips through it leaving a hole His head is plunged into the toilet It is late and the supermarket is all but deserted The Dude has his Ralph's Shopper's Club card to one side and is making out a check to Ralph's for sixtynine cents
